name: Managing the Stall
description: Evaporative cooling can flatten internal temp rise; consider wrapping or waiting it out.

name: Wrapping (Texas Crutch)
description: Wrap with foil or butcher paper to push through stall and protect bark/moisture.

name: Spritzing
description: Light spritz can help smoke adhesion and surface moistureâ€”suggestion, not requirement.

name: Resting & Holding
description: Resting redistributes juices; warm holds can tenderize and improve slice texture.

name: Clean Smoke
description: Thin blue smoke from a clean fire avoids bitterness.

name: Reverse Sear
description: Cook low to temp, then finish hot for crust without overcooking inside.

name: Pellicle Formation
description: Air-dry cured fish to tacky surface for better smoke and glaze adhesion.
